name: Ryan Cohen
bio: Founded Chewey at 25 in 2011.  By 2016, he had raised capital from investors including BlackRock and T. Rowe Price New Horizons Fund. That year the company had $900 million in sales and had become the number 1 online pet retailer. In April 2017, PetSmart purchased Chewy for $3.35 billion in the largest e-commerce acquisition of all time. In January 2021, Cohen joined the GameStop board along with two Chewy executives. Cohen was also appointed Chairman to lead a new committee in charge of a company-wide transformation. Ryan Cohen is the largest individual Apple shareholder. He also has a 10% stake in Bed Bath and Beyond and a 12.9% stake in Gamestop. (Click for link to Wiki).
quote: Inflated compensation across Corporate America is deplorable. Is this connected to over a decade of negative real interest rates and massive stimulus?
